You might think that because this is Kindergarten math it might not be interesting, but when you learn it in Kindergarten they don't explain the "why" to ANYTHING because you're a stupid, wild child who needs to be bribed with gummy candy to sit still and do your homework.  Explanations go over your head.  By the time you're old enough to comprehend any you're already out of school and so unless you refresh yourself it remains unexplained.  All of this means that, even though I know what 2+2 is, this is still blowing my mind. Explaining what equation means, WHY something subtracted by another is what it is, instead of just saying THAT it is, all of that and more is completely glossed over when you first learn it. Learning it for a second time here is, again, blowing my mind.

in 3+2=5, it's not quite right to interpret the equation as 3 and 2 give 5 but rather that the number 3+2 is the same as the number 5. 3+2 is the number obtained by adding 2 to 3 and it turns out to be the same number as 5. 3+2 is name of a number, it doesn't tell us to perform an operation.

there is a big mistake, its often thought the symbol "Minus" or "plus" is only a operation, but, really is the sign of the right number (The symbol says about if the number is negative or positive). So, subtraction and addition are commutative and associative, because the sign always have to be with its corresponding number.

Honestly, I’m not super lost on math but there were some little (but important) things I missed out on due to things completely out of control. I’m a sophomore now, and I had not been taught division and knew very little multiplication. Year after year, more and more was added. Being asked to build a house when I knew nothing past how to make the foundation. I’d be embarrassed when confronted, but also far too embarrassed to explain why I didn’t know. My childhood wasn’t golden, and it is something I found myself wishing to hide for a better image. I don’t think it helps that my brain has trouble even processing normal things. I’d been treated badly by a lot of people and now you could tell me the sky was orange and I’d doubt my eyes in favor of your claim. I’d feel the need to believe.  You know whats terrible?  I was shamed and they moved on. No one took the time to teach me. And I felt dreadfully ashamed to look it up. I got over it though, and here I am. No matter what it was that brought anyone older here, It's okay! We all have reasons and you being here and wanting to learn on any of these is wonderful. Lots of us had no control over it and no one took us back to the opportunity. I promise you all that math can also be fun, and very pretty when done correctly. (I love how it looks, and how nice it is to complete something complex)  I’m proud of you. Refresh, relearn, or start-up. It's all very good.

but dave i learned subtraction is associative because subtraction should added separately 5-3-2 => 5-5 =>0. you can't do 5-3-2 => 5-(3-2) because 3 and 2 has minus symbol. To do in correct way 5-3-2 => 5-(3+2) here, i took minus has common outside the bracket =>5-5 =>0.
